item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 19: The New Work
item.description:
The question everyone asks is wrong.

“What jobs will AI take?” assumes a fixed pie of work that AI and humans divide between them. It treats labor as a zero-sum competition where every AI capability is a human loss.

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 38: The Long Collaboration
item.description:
The previous articles asked how to design AI companions that serve child development. How embodied robots in communities might reintroduce developmental nutrients that screen-based AI removes.

But those articles treated childhood as the destination. As if the goal were raising a well-developed child and then the work is done.
